bio: Patrick Löwenstein is a Vienna based Android developer, currently working at the mobile app agency Tailored Apps. Also, he is studying for his Master's degree in Computer Sciences at the Vienna University of Technology. Patrick also has an Android dev blog and is active on GitHub.
Gautier is an aspiring Software Craftsman in Paris, France. When he grows up, he wants to be Aleksander "pelotasplus" Piotrowski.

Paul found his way into mobile technologies through mobile device interaction and his need to scratch an itch for entrepreneurship. Co-founding Pixplicity in 2011, Paul has helped grow the company into a familiar name between Dutch app builders, with brands such as De Telegraaf, Consumentenbond and Mercedes-Benz. His passion for Android has always compelled him to keep up with the latest developments and share knowledge by contributing into the open-source and chairing the GDG The Dutch Android User Group. He can frequently be seen giving tech talks & workshops at conferences across the globe.

Caner is a GDE on UX/UI who is also a technology geek. Mainly focused on the design and marketing of mobile applications. Passionate about good UX, IoT and Android. He works at InnovationBox, a design agency in Istanbul making and creating apps that users love. Caner has been an organiser of GDG Istanbul since 2013, organising, participating, and speaking at events.

Danny is in charge of Android development at Viacom in Berlin. Before that he worked for companies like Groupon, eBay and Alcatel. His mobile career started long before any iPhone with Java ME and Blackberry applications. Danny writes and talks about mobile development and testing regularly.

Marcos Placona is a developer evangelist at Twilio, a company founded to disrupt telecommunications. He spends most of his time working with Android and .Net open source projects while equipping and inspiring developers to build killer applications. He’s also a great API enthusiast and believes they bring peace to the Software Engineering world.

Android developer for the past 5 years, I have been working for companies like the United Nations and Telecom Italia on projects like ShareTheMeal (Google Play Best of 2015) and the Sochi Winter Olympics app. Coauthor of the Grokking Rx for Manning Publishing.

websiteTitle: Coder and professional dreamer @ Grid Dynamics
bio: I am a professional and ambitious software engineer with more than five years of experience in designing and implementing advanced Java Android applications. I am an Agile thinker and an active practitioner of Scrum/Kanban methodologies. I am passionate about Android and mobile technologies and I pride myself in advocating clean coding and robust unit testing.

Elif Boncuk has been working on mobile technologies especially on Android (since Eclair) and also IOS as a full-stack developer more than 5 years, since the team formation in her current company. She is a Senior Software Specialist at Garanti Technology. Her passionate about Android is making apps more performant. Elif is engaged with GDG and WTM Istanbul as organizer. She loves to speak at tech events and also organize and attend to them. She blogs in her native language at her blog(elifboncuk.wordpress.com) about everything but mostly tech and also at Medium in English and only tech. In addition, she loves to travel and she is a professional photographer but her favourite photography object is Android sculpture. You can find her taking photos with Androids at any time.

Egor is a professional Android developer living in München, Germany. He’s been crafting Android apps for more than 6 years, and is currently building an end-to-end encrypted XMPP-based messaging solution at 1&1. Egor is passionate about everything Android, likes to experiment with new tools and libraries, and writes about his experiences in a personal blog.

I’m a Senior Android Engineer and I have been writing cool apps since Android 2.3. Recently, I’ve been a technical lead on the Bumble project which brought us over 1M users on Android within first 8 months.

Anton has been developing for Android since late 2010. Made a long way from a CTO to an engineer. Passionate about clean code/architecture and testing, he is also a big fan of complex CI systems with 'one button to rule them all'. At Juno, develops an Android app in Kotlin + Rx for more than a year. One of the Google Developer Group Minsk organizers and an active speaker.

Kamil is a Software Engineer living in Cracow, Poland. Currently working at Azimo. He’s has been sticking to mobile application development for about 3 years. Started as an Android Developer currently found joy in mobile automation related topics. He likes to play with many different technologies. By solving various daily problems he tries to create developer-friendly working environment by making their work even faster and more efficient.

Android Developer for 5 years now. I work at Karify where we are building an online healthcare platform to help treat and manage patients in Mental healthcare. I work on the Android app and helped build the REST Api for the platform. Before I joined Karify I worked at an agency on different large and small App projects. Beside making awesome Apps I help manage the technical part of the food blog Betty’s Kitchen which is run by my wife

Hi, my names Joe. I’m an Android Engineer based in Brighton, UK working on the Android team at Buffer. I’m passionate about coding and love creating robust, polished and exciting projects for mobile, the web, TV, wearables and I’ll probably be toying with whatever the new thing is at the time you’re reading this – I love to be constantly learning.I’m also a keen writer as I love to share my learnings and experiences with others.

Sarah is a Berlin based software engineer. She has been hacking all her life, first in electronics (many toasters were hurt in the process). For the last 8+ years she has been involved with the software industry in various roles, mainly as a software engineer. She keeps busy during the day as an Senior Android Developer at Magic Internet in Berlin. On her off time, she hacks away on various embedded projects.

For the third time proud speaker at droidcon Kraków. Active member of developers community. As the author of RoboSpock is a strong believer in TDD. Person who really cares about code quality. Currently working for Applause creating Android SDK library and auto instrumentation service.

Developer Advocate at Google London, helping developers leverage the power of Android Studio and Tools, as well as providing general outreach for the Android platform. Previously member of the Google Developer Experts program and co-founder and long time organiser at GDG Warsaw.

Telerik Developer Expert, GDG Lead, and NG/JS Algeria ( North Africa ) meetup founder, I always was a community lover and supporter, therefore I develop content, cool demos and record awesome workshops whenever i have time. in short I do believe that sharing is caring.

Andreas is a mobile software engineer at Pollfish building its SDKs for different platforms. He has been developing mobile apps since the early days of feature phones with J2ME and has a strong interest in mobile monetization tactics and trends and how they are applied in an app’s design.

I am a passionate android dev and mobile technology enthusiast. By day, I am developing awesome apps at Five, a design driven agency. And in my free time, I am trying out new technologies, tinker around my side projects and I love to grab a fine, cold beer or two.

A software leader with more than 20 years of technology experience in the telecommunications industry, bringing a broad vision in sales, marketing, and customer care to start-up and high-growth companies. Using Android since day one and thus highly experienced with AsyncTask, ListView and Java 6 programming.

Sergii Zhuk is Android Software Engineer at Zalando SE (Berlin). Passionated with programming since high school, he has started his career as Java backend developer, but later switched to Android. Sergii is the author of Android Digest for Ukrainian Software Developers Community (DOU.ua) and speaker at various tech events.

A diversified Software Engineer who started with Android since 2009. Selim has a wide spectrum of ICT knowledge with more than 7 years of professional experience in the IT industry within corporate, startups and academia. Selim has conducted presentations, workshops in Android, IoT and related fields in Droidcon, Code.Talks, DevFest and other Android meetups. Selim is living the diversity and enjoys PingPong!

Oleksandr is a passionate Android Developer. Working at Sharewire as an Android developer he develops various applications, from simple UI-pretty clients applications to complicated ad frameworks. Over more than 5 years in Android Industries he has tried a variety of different technologies and frameworks, but his favorite topics are continuous integration, testing, all kinds of optimisations and material design, of course.

I'm a passionate developer in Colombia, currently working for Huge in Medellin. Focused in trying to show the world that code matters and it can be done with great quality and speed. With the Android community in Colombia I was able to gain more expertice about great ideas from Clean Code, Agile, TDD and performance.

Head of Mobile at Tango Agency and Android developer. Big fan of reactive programming and design patterns. In his free time, he is developing Scrobble FM application, which has been recognized in competitions conducted by the portals AntyApps.pl and Android.com.pl. Besides programming, his time is effectively fulfilled by the culinary experiments and photography.

Abhinandan is Android Engineers at Go-Jek Engineering. He was in devops team previously before transitioning to android and now he is developing Android Apps and the CI/CD setup for the iOS/Android builds at Go-Jek, Indonesia
Gurupratap is a product engineer working at an Indonesian startup called Go-Jek. Currently he is working as an android developer and has worked on the Continuous Integration setup of Android/iOS apps

I’m Android Developer living in Krakow and working in ColorTv where we are focused on Tv related technologies like AndroidTv, FireTv, AppleTv, RokuTv and Chromecast. I do enjoy learning new technologies and doing some cool stuff with them. In private I love to travel and I can’t live without visiting some new places every few months.

Maciej is a passionate Android developer. He cares about writing clean code and less of it. He is spending time to automate things to save even more time. He also bikes a lot and would love to be able to code while doing it… using only mind controlled wearables or bikeables.
Android Developer. Works in Kotlin, hates Java. He's a really poor developer, so he has to test his code all the time. He also cares about automation and spreading knowledge.

Android Developer @ El Passion. He used to develop backend solutions, but mobile applications turned out to be the love from the first try. Fascinated about writing clean code and Agile methodologies. He cares a lot about readablity and simplicity. Speaker at GDG DevFest Poland, DroidCon Italy and Mobile Warsaw.

Android developer. He is as short as his functions written in Kotlin. Any untested line of code in project gives him a great opportunity for a revert. He appreciates CI, as it runs hundreds of his tests. Loves clean code and good architecture.
I worked on exciting Android apps for finance industry and public safety. Currently having a brief affair with firebase as a side project.
